revised_title: Measurement of Helium Production Rates in Thorianite and Pitchblende
tldr: The author measures the rate at which helium is produced in thorianite and pitchblende, providing a minimum estimate of their antiquity. The experiments involve dissolving the minerals in nitric acid, filtering out insoluble residues, and boiling the solutions to remove helium. The results contribute to understanding geological time and the decay of radioactive materials.
